incidents.name: Super SIM and Programmable Wireless Connectivity Issues Due to Cellular Infrastructure Provider Incident

incident_updates.body: Major US network operators are reporting problems with a common downstream service provider that manages roaming connections for various carriers. All major North American operators are involved in a multi-company bridge for troubleshooting. There is no estimated time of repair at this time. This may be causing some connectivity issues for Programmable Wireless and Super SIM users, particularly on devices using 2G and 3G or SMS failures. We will provide another update in 2 hours or as soon as more information becomes available.

We continue to see recovery of the network connectivity issue for Programmable Wireless and Super SIM users. We are continuing to monitor for service stability. We will provide another update in 2 hours or as soon as more information becomes available.

We will provide another update in 8 hours or as soon as more information becomes available.

We are no longer experiencing phone number status issues during the porting process. The incident has been resolved
